        <title><![CDATA[Business Development Officer]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
Launched in 2007, 1st Merchant Funding is a leading provider of merchant cash advance products to small and medium-sized businesses. 
  
 
  
Job Summary: The Business Development Officer is responsible for the development and growth of funding volume and revenue for our organization.  As a key member of the company?s business development team, your role will be to retain, build and foster partner relationships in the small business financing industry, with the goal of growing the quantity and quality of our funding volume.
  
 
  
In this role you will:
  
 
  
 
  
+ Establish/build relationships with high-value partners through inbound/outbound calls, emails, and face-to-face meetings
  
 
  
+ Proactively converse with our partner base daily, with the objective of increasing funding volume
  
 
  
+ Monitor individual partner performance regularly, and reach out proactively to improve performance
  
 
  
+ Work directly with management on sales initiatives
  
 
  
+ Aggressively expand our current network of quality referral partners
  
 
  
+ Learn how our financing options can help the many challenges small businesses face 
  
 
  
+ Proactively and effectively communicate to our strategic partners our product offerings
  
 
  
+ Manage on-boarding and elevation of strategic partners
  
 
  
+ Collaborate with account managers to identify and implement new polies and procedures to improve overall partner experience
  
 
  
 
  
Qualifications:
  
 
  
 
  
+ Ability to create and foster business relationships
  
 
  
+ We are looking for a highly motivated, enthusiastic and energetic candidate with a ?go get it? attitude.
  
 
  
+ Accuracy and attention to detail with the ability to see the bigger picture
  
 
  
+ Very organized and capable of prioritizing in a dynamic work environment.
  
 
  
+ Ability to multi-task while managing deadlines, to perform well under pressure and to work independently and as a part of a team
  
 
  
+ Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal
  
 
  
+ Strong work ethic in a high-performance environment 
  
 
  
+ Effective time management and experience balancing quality and efficiency
  
 
  
 
  
What we are looking for in you:
  
 
  
Competitiveness: The job exists within a demanding environment where consistently winning is critical. The job demands tenacity, boldness, assertiveness and a ?will to win? in dealing with highly competitive situations. 
  
 
  
Articulate: Speaks and writes clearly and articulately without being overly verbose or talkative. Maintains this standard in all forms of written communication, including email. 
  
 
  
Proactive: The ability to evaluate future implications of current decisions and action; the ability to mentally create the scenarios and outcomes of situations that could develop from decisions or plans of action. 
  
 
  
Analytically minded: Able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw insightful conclusions from it. Exhibits a probing mind and achieves penetrating insights. 
  
 
  
High Energy: Being excited and thriving in a dynamic, fast-paced, and growing organization 
  
 
  
Aggressive: Moves quickly and takes a forceful stand without being overly abrasive 
  
 
  
Good Judgement: Strong business acumen and excellent logic and reasoning skills, ability to exercise great judgment while working independently in a fast-paced environment 
  
 
  
Persistent: Demonstrates tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done.
  
 
  
Resourceful: Ability to think creatively to source information and get things done 
  
 
  
Confident: The ability to develop and maintain inner strength based on desire to succeed; a person?s belief that he or she possesses the capabilities to succeed. 
  
 
  
Requirements:
  
 
  
 
  
+ Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business/Finance/Marketing 
  
 
  
+ 2-5 years of experience in sales or account management
  
 
  
+ Prior experience in building a customer/referral network ? a strong plus
  
 
  
+ 1+ years of specialty finance experience?a strong plus
  
 
  
 
  
 
  
 
  
Benefits and Perks Medical/dental/vision insurance, 401k matching program, flex spending plan and life insurance Paid/flexible vacations and holidays.
  
 
  
1st Merchant Funding LLC and its affiliates are equal opportunity employers that exercise high ethical standards and are committed to complying with all laws in the jurisdictions where they conduct business.

        <title><![CDATA[Collections Manager]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
COLLECTIONS MANAGER POSITION SPECIFICATION
  
 
  
Launched in 2007, 1st Merchant Funding (the ?Company?) is a leading provider of merchant cash advance products available to small and medium-sized businesses. The Company utilizes data aggregation and electronic payment receipts in conjunction with proprietary scoring models to evaluate the financial health of small businesses, and provide immediate working capital as quick as two business days. The Company has one of the industry?s largest independent sales networks with over 2,600 independent sales agents marketing its cash advance products. Businesses typically use the Company?s capital to fund expansion, purchase equipment and inventory, increase advertising, manage unexpected expenses and take advantage of seasonal opportunities.  The Company is also the exclusive gatekeeper of, PowerForce®, the industry?s leading disruptive financial technology platform. For more information about the Company, visit www.1stmerchantfunding.com.
  
 
  
The Collections Manager role will be based in Miami. Insurance benefits are available the first of the month following sixty days with the Company. 1st Merchant Funding is a growing, technology enabled, fast paced, collaborative and team-oriented financial services firm. We are actively seeking qualified candidates for this role and growth opportunity.
  
 
  
The Company is seeking a collections professional to manage the day-to-day operations of our Asset Management Team. This position reports to the Vice President of Finance.  The qualified candidate must always conduct themselves in a professional manner and will ensure any non-performing accounts are actively managed in order to safeguard the assets from unnecessary losses.  Follow up on all open and pending items, together with a high degree of reliability on job performance and consistency, is critical to success.
  
 
  
Essential Job Functions:
  
 
  
- Identify and act on non-performing or slow pay accounts and demonstrate proven results.  Actions include placing direct phone calls and emails to business owners and/or principals. Actively involved with business owners and/or principals relative to investigating and returning their accounts back to performing status, communicating internally and through the Company?s systems, and if applicable, turning over non-performing accounts to third party collection firm.  Follow up on all actions, including with the business owner, principal, Vice President of Finance, Director of Asset Management, and others is essential.
  
 
  
 
  
+ Communications with Company?s partners on issues with respect to accounts they originated and seeking their input and support.
  
 
  
+ Maintaining detailed records on all actions taken in this role.  Prepares documentation and correspondence necessary to perform responsibilities.
  
 
  
+ Review accounts for discrepancies and potential issues.
  
 
  
+ Skip tracing where applicable.
  
 
  
+ Aid in development of operational procedures and process improvements.
  
 
  
+ Close collaborate with the Company?s Management and Finance Team regarding Asset Management metrics, performance on accounts, strategic approaches to certain accounts where necessary, and write off of those accounts where appropriate
  
 
  
+ Following instructions and input from the Director of Asset Management and others relative to work performed. 
  
 
  
+ Delivering on related duties and activities as may be assigned.
  
 
  
 
  
Information accessed and gathered may include confidential and sensitive information of the Company and its merchants. Safeguarding all of this confidential information is an essential part of this role. In addition, strict adherence to compliance of all applicable laws and regulations relative to the performance of the duties hereunder is essential. This role and the corresponding duties may expand to other items as may be requested by the Company. 
  
 
  
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
  
 
  
 
  
+ High school diploma (or G.E.D) and a college degree is required.
  
 
  
+ Highly recommended that the incumbent to have at least 3 years of experience in collecting, accounts receivable or a related area.
  
 
  
+ This position requires good written, oral and reading communication skills in order to accurately interpret and transcribe a variety of communications and instructions.
  
 
  
+ Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word and Excel) is required.
  
 
  
+ This position requires excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to adjust and interact with all levels of personnel.
